intro: Sulcorebutia tarijensis subsp. carichimayuensis, commonly known as the Carichimayuensis Cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and cylindrical stems. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it a popular choice for succulent enthusiasts. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
